oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: attrib. Johann Albert Lotz (1820-1905)
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newel Post
Lotz House, Newel Post
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wooden newel post carved with alternating decorative panels and "S" shaped scrolls.

This oversized newel post is found in the foyer of the house that Johann Albert Lotz built in 1858, located across the street from the brick home of Fountain Branch Carter. Lotz, a skilled carpenter and German immigrant, is known to have built the home as a showpiece of his talent. The newel post, is attributed to Lotz, but may be a later addition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Woodcarving
Newels; Stairways
Walking a Fine Line
